Sentencas: Atmospheric plasma spraying (APS) is attractive for manufacturing solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) because it allows functional layers to be built rapidly with controlled microstructures.
Titulo: Atmospheric Plasma Spraying Low-Temperature Cathode Materials for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The technique allows SOFCs that operate at low temperatures (500-700 A degrees C) to be fabricated by spraying directly onto robust and inexpensive metallic supports.
Titulo: Atmospheric Plasma Spraying Low-Temperature Cathode Materials for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: However, standard cathode materials used in commercial SOFCs exhibit high polarization resistances at low operating temperatures.
Titulo: Atmospheric Plasma Spraying Low-Temperature Cathode Materials for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Therefore, alternative cathode materials with high performance at low temperatures are essential to facilitate the use of metallic supports.
Titulo: Atmospheric Plasma Spraying Low-Temperature Cathode Materials for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Coatings of lanthanum strontium cobalt ferrite (LSCF) were fabricated on steel substrates using axial-injection APS.
Titulo: Atmospheric Plasma Spraying Low-Temperature Cathode Materials for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The thickness and microstructure of the coating layers were evaluated, and x-ray diffraction analysis was performed on the coatings to detect material decomposition and the formation of undesired phases in the plasma.
Titulo: Atmospheric Plasma Spraying Low-Temperature Cathode Materials for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: These results determined the envelope of plasma spray parameters in which coatings of LSCF can be manufactured, and the range of conditions in which composite cathode coatings could potentially be manufactured.
Titulo: Atmospheric Plasma Spraying Low-Temperature Cathode Materials for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
